external_accountability.findings: Code of Ethics documents reference audits and reviews of operations, and proxy statements describe the engagement of independent auditors. Policy documents describe mechanisms for operational execution, risk management oversight by the Audit Committee, and the use of third-party models. Furthermore, Form 10-K filings describe an annual internal audit, and SEC filings describe the engagement of third-party experts for testing and evaluation of cybersecurity practices.

relevant_sources.summary: ExxonMobil's "Code of Ethics" charter provides evidence for **external_accountability** and **governance**. The document supports external_accountability and governance by mentioning audits and reviews of operations. It further demonstrates governance through commitments to anti-corruption standards, compliance programs, employee training on compliance topics, and a system for assessing, monitoring, and reporting risks.
relevant_sources.title: Code of Ethics

relevant_sources.summary: ExxonMobil's 2025 Proxy Statement provides evidence for **governance**, **oversight**, **external accountability**, **fairness**, and **privacy**. The document details the Board's role in AI governance, including oversight of AI principles and guardrails for safety, security, fairness, and privacy. It also describes various oversight mechanisms, such as committee reviews of cybersecurity and internal controls, and the engagement of independent auditors, supporting external accountability.
relevant_sources.title: 2025 Proxy Statement (DEF 14A)

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Governance & Executive Compensation - Sustainability Report," provides evidence for the **governance** and **external_accountability** pillars. It details board oversight of strategy, including climate and energy transition risks, and references discussions on technology opportunities and risks relevant to AI governance. The report also describes mechanisms for operational execution, risk management oversight by the Audit Committee, and the use of third-party models, all of which contribute to demonstrating governance and external accountability.
relevant_sources.title: Governance & Executive Compensation - Sustainability Report

relevant_sources.summary: This 2024 Form 10-K filing provides evidence for **governance**, **oversight**, **external accountability**, and **privacy**. The document details the Board and Audit Committee's oversight of cybersecurity risks, the deployment of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework for risk assessment, and third-party validation, demonstrating robust governance and oversight mechanisms. Furthermore, it highlights practices related to data integrity, access controls, and an annual internal audit, which support the privacy and external accountability pillars by ensuring data protection and independent review.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Form 10-K

relevant_sources.summary: This SEC filing, a third-party analysis of ExxonMobil's cybersecurity program, provides evidence for **external accountability, governance, and oversight**. The analysis details the company's adherence to industry standards like the NIST Cybersecurity Framework, the existence of an incident response plan, and regular reporting to senior management and the Audit Committee, demonstrating robust governance and oversight mechanisms. Furthermore, the engagement of third-party experts for testing and evaluation highlights external accountability and validation of their cybersecurity practices.

summary.overall_findings: Operational and policy-level evidence for responsible AI practices is documented in Exxon Mobil's public disclosures, covering 6 of 7 evaluated pillars. For instance, transparency policy documents reference AI capabilities, while governance materials describe AI strategy elements and a structured approach to data assessment. Additionally, external accountability is supported by Code of Ethics documents referencing audits and reviews of operations. Fairness is addressed at the policy level, with materials stating a commitment to fairness through principles and referencing industry standards. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability, based on a review of 16 publicly available sources.
